text.title: part10_Augusten Burroughs on addiction, writing, his family and his new book

p: AB: I wouldn't say that I believe in one. I don't know. I don't know if there's an organizing principle to the universe, or if there's a sentient being that is the architect of everything--you know, everything being the "observable-and-beyond" universe. I don't know. I would like to know. I would like to know--I don't believe in any God that has been described by man in any way. I certainly don't believe in the Islamic or the Jewish or the Christian God. I don't believe a word of the Bible, I don't believe a word of any organized religion and I don't have any firm belief whatsoever, other than I don't know. I can't say that I don't believe, because I really don't know. I would love to know.

p.hi: DS: Did you ever come close to believing?

p: AB: Yeah. Oh, yeah. Oh, yeah, I have. As a child, I was very--I would almost say religious, as a child. I prayed constantly, obsessively even. So I was very, very, very religious as a child, or spiritual as a child. And I went through another burst of spirituality, I think, when I got sober.

p.hi: DS: Did it feel false to you?

p: AB: You know, it was funny, because I was able to really go with it and suspend--
I was able to just go with it and just--pretend--I acted as if, and it just totally worked.

p.hi: DS: Which I think a lot of people do.

p: AB: Mmm-hmmm. And that's the thing, I mean if you--
AB: Yeah, yeah, and I mean, now I'm making it, and I don't really have to fake it.

p.hi: DS: What was your higher power, then?

p: AB: I used to visualize--it's ridiculous, it's ridiculous. But I just visualized a cartoon Jesus in the sky with a pet cow --
AB: The baby Jesus, you know, like--that's what I visualized--just a very cartoon version of Jesus, plucked from the manger with a pet cow.

p.hi: DS: Sounds like something--that it would be great if one of your fans drew for you.

p: AB: Yeah, that would be great. I wish they would.
AB: And now I'm going to get a stack--

p.hi: DS: A swarm of cows and cartoon Jesuses. Youâ€™ll have to start a collection.

p: AB: I'm going to get a stack of them.
I would like to be a physicist. I would like to find out--because that's the question that physics seeks to answer, ultimately.
